data.title: Fun for the Whole Family
data.text: We took our six and eight year old climbing here and they had so much fun. The staff were so friendly and helpful and our kids were both off and climbing within minutes of getting there. They had so much fun and were so worn out!

data.title: Haven't been since I got a dog.
data.text:
I have been coming here when in town for a couple years now. Haven't really made it this year since I've gotten my pup. 

This gym has two levels of bouldering walls, a slide to get down after you top out, space to train and do some floor work, slack lines, and I guess the serve beer?

If they had a dogsitter or something I would be a member.

data.title: Great for young kids
data.text: We visited the Cityrock climbing center with our family of 6.  Within minutes, my kids ages 5-12 were scaling 40 foot walls with ease.  The ropes system they have in place makes it safe in case they fall. And also easy to get down when they hit the ceiling.  The center obviously caters to climbers of all skill levels but there were at least 10 different climbs suitable for kids.  We spent 2 hours there and loved every minute. First rate facility!

data.title: So Much Fun!!! Excellent Staff!
data.text: My two boys 8 and 15 loved this place!!! More walls than you can climb in an hour. Great prices and the staff was super friendly getting the boys fitted and trained. Definitely recommend coming and giving it a try.

data.title: Interesting Climbing
data.text:
The orientation video is hysterical! The facility has multi-level bouldering with a top-out to a slide, slack lines, a wide variety of routes for top-rope and lead. There are auto-belays that cover many of the routes so not having a climbing partner isn't a problem. 

The rating system was a bit challenging 5.10s and up were labeled with + or - versus a/b/c/d and a few varied wildly. One 5.11- was more like a 5.9 ish and another was closer to a 5.12+ range.But most seemed consistent in the range listed. The artwork on the walls is colorful, but at times distracting when trying to find your holds. Overall the climbing was good. Interesting routes and fun bouldering problems. Climbing at high altitude was very hard for my closer to sea-level dwelling family.

data.title: Amazing amount of fun for anyone of any experience level!
data.text:
I went climbing for the very first time a couple of weeks ago and had a blast!!  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and there are lots of climbs to choose from.  When we went back the 2nd time, one of the staff started showing us how to belay.  Again, very friendly and welcoming--made it a point to shake our hands and get our names.

Nice little bar/restaurant in the front--even the gal working the bar made it a point to introduce herself, as us our names and welcome us. 

This is great place even if you are brand spanking new to climbing.

data.title: Huge place
data.text: Large climbing gym with auto belays, bouldering, and lead climbing. It's big for a downtown indoor gym. There are many routes and options. Day pass is quite pricey at $17 a person, if you bring your own equipment. There is a cafe connected to it. Evenings are really busy.

data.title: Super fun climbing everytime
data.text: We come here every year and always have a great time on our vacation.  Friendly, knowlegable staff every time we come.  We will come back!

data.title: Fun for kids and adults
data.text: If you've not climbed here below, you have to watch a short but well done and interested video on safety.  I bring my grandkids here (ages 2 - 9) and they spend a couple hours climbing the walls with the automatic belay systems.  There is a great kids room with not-so-high walls, a zipline, a slide, secret passage and great padded floors.  It's a wonderful way to get kids active and away from technology.  Staff are great and help with shoes and harnesses and all the basics.  Group classes for all ages and lesson are also available.

data.title: Fantastic Rock Gym!
data.text: I've been rock climbing gyms around the world and this definitely ranks in my top 2. There is so much bouldering that one can never get bored! There are a couple of roofs and some vertical areas. There are 2 floors dedicated to bouldering. There is also a dedicated training area and lots of top roping and lead climbing. If you like slack lining, there are various degrees of difficulty of it. The mats that you land on make you feel very safe. The workers are friendly as well.

data.title: Fun for all ages
data.text: This place is awesome!!! It is a little costly, but once you get a hang of it, you can find a reasonable option ( membership or punch pass) Our son is 7 and he loves this place. We go on Sundays so that we can climb for hours. No belay card needed..you can use auto belay!!  A must do!!!! It's so much fun!!!

data.title: Amazingly Fun and Good Exercise Too
data.text: My wife, kids (ages 8 and 11), sister, and teenage niece visited CityRock while on vacation.  I went expecting it to be something that would keep the kids busy for a little while on a cold wet day.  However, I was very surprised just how amazing this place was.  The climbing center features a large bouldering area and a huge area for on belay areas.  The best part is they have approximately 12 auto belays for people climbing by themselves or for beginners who don't know how to belay a partner, such as my family.  The staff was incredible in showing us how to use the equipment and to make sure we knew all the safety rules.  They were outstanding when my sister did her 5th climb and for some reason froze at the top.  No matter what we did we could not get her to climb down or use the auto belay.  The staff climbed up and talked to her.  They were superb in making her feel confident enough to climb down.  Once down they made her feel good and ease her embarrassment by explaining to her it can happen to even the most experienced climbers.  Their demeanor was awesome and gave her confidence again so soon she was back climbing again on her own.  We ended up spending about 5 hours at the center and my whole family had a blast.  My kids climbed so much and had so much fun we are now looking for similar places in the state we live in.  We highly recommend CityRock whether you're an experienced climber looking for a spot to practice, or are a beginner wanting to try it out.   We will definitely be returning on our next trip to the Colorado Springs area.

data.title: Good value for great climbing venue
data.text: My grandson is a senior in high school and LOVES this place.  Great way for me to give him a gift he'll use when I buy him "time" at this facility.  They have excellent equipment and a full, knowledgable & friendly staff!.  Reasonable fees!!!!

data.title: Fun for all ages!
data.text: Every summer we come to Cityrock on our mini vacation to the Springs!   My 2 teens and I climbed all day long!  (I am incredibly sore now, but it was totally worth it!).  It is a great value for the money and you can rent everything you need for a great price!  The staff is very knowledgeable, helpful and safe!  Even if you have never climbed or climbed very little, you can have lots of fun here!  Definitely a destination in the Springs you will want to hit if you like to be active together on your vacations!

data.title: YAY!
data.text: Fun for all ages... Open all year round, which is great because rocks don't like to work in the winter.. they pretty much refuse... rocks are jerks...

data.title: Plenty of variety and not overly crowded
data.text: Great for all levels, including lead, bouldering and top rope.  Slack lines and a few ice climbing style routes as well.

data.title: Really big place well run
data.text: Kids loved this place auto belay made it easy no pressure and a ton of great routes bouldering area and slide was kids fav. Over all great time

data.title: Great place for all ages!
data.text: I took my wife and daughters here on a cloudy day and we had a blast! All of us were " newbies" and the staff was awesome, they made us feel safe and confident! The facility is FANTASTIC, a great way to beat the weather! See you again!

data.title: The Ultimate Training Ground
data.text:
My husband and I used to drive all the way to Denver to prepare for sport climbing trips to areas like the Red River Gorge in Kentucky and Maple Canyon in Utah. We were so excited when we heard about this new gym in town with 43' walls, great for working out endurance. 

CityRock also offers plenty of terrain for climbers of all ages and any experience level. I can happily take family members into CityRock when they come to visit and everyone has a great time. I'll always be a regular around CityRock!
